lead_paragraph: Those countries, which have significant atomic stockpiles or nuclear power plants, do little to protect them from such intrusions, the Nuclear Threat Initiative says.

headline.main: Nuclear Facilities in 20 Countries May Be Easy Targets for Cyberattacks
headline.print_headline: Nuclear Facilities in 20 Countries May Be Easy Targets for Cyberattacks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

abstract: Nuclear Threat Initiative study says twenty countries lack rules requiring protection of their nuclear facilities against cyberattacks; emerging consensus points to cyberattack as simplest way to breach installations' security systems; report also shows Pres Obama's campaign to secure nuclear material worldwide has slowed, which some blame on frayed ties with Russia.
